column2: PA DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: Pennsylvania
column6: PA

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. When traveling below 40 MPH on a limited access highway, you should:
column4: sound your horn to warn others.
column6: use your four-way flashers.

column2: 2. Which of the following is a defensive driving skill/technique?
column4: Maintain the correct speed.
column6: Keep your vehicle in good condition.
column8: Do not drive if you are very weary.

column2: 3. Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
column4: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.
column6: motorcycles are slower than cars.
column8: motorcycles take up less of your field of vision.
column10: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.

column2: 4. Before crossing any railroad tracks, you must:
column4: look and listen for trains.
column6: make sure there is room for your vehicle on the other side.
column8: wait until the crossing gates are completely up.

column2: 5. If you get on a wrong expressway exit, you must:
column4: drive in reverse to return to the expressway.
column6: use the the exit ramp to accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column8: make a U-turn and return to the expressway.
column10: get off at the next exit and look for signs that tell you how to return to the expressway.

column2: 6. When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
column4: look both ways and be ready to stop.
column6: pass other vehicles and then stop.
column10: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.

column2: 7. You are waiting to turn left at a multilane intersection, and opposing traffic is blocking your view. You should:
column4: accelerate rapidly when the first lane you need to cross is clear.
column6: wait for the opposing driver to wave you across the intersection.
column8: edge your car into each lane of opposing traffic as soon as it clears.
column10: wait until you can see all the lanes you need to cross before going ahead with your turn.

column2: 8. Drinking alcohol while taking drugs can:
column4: have a less pronounced effect than either taken separately.
column6: improve your driving performance.
column10: have a more pronounced effect than either taken separately.

column2: 9. Drivers should be aware that a motorcyclist may:
column4: quickly change speed or lane position.
column6: decrease speed and rise off the seat when approaching a railroad crossing.
column8: move to the center of the lane on steel deck bridges.

column2: 10. What does a flashing yellow light mean?
column4: The same thing as a stop sign.
column6: Drivers may move forward with caution.

column2: 11. From top to bottom, traffic lights are:
column4: red, green and yellow.
column6: green, yellow and red.

column2: 12. __________ limit(s) your concentration, perception, judgment, and memory.
column4: Even the smallest amount of alcohol
column6: Only a blood alcohol level greater than the legal limit
column8: Only a blood alcohol level greater than .05

column2: 13. When teenage drivers have other teenage passengers in their vehicle the likelihood of a crash:
column4: is inversely proportional to the number of passengers.
column6: is increased due to heightened distractions.
column10: is much higher because some of the passengers might not hold a driver's license.

column2: 14. When you make a left turn from a two-way road into a four-lane highway, you must:
column4: enter the right lane. When traffic permits, you can move out of the left lane.
column6: go straight through the intersection, and then make the turn.
column8: enter the right lane, to the left of the center line.
column10: enter the left lane, to the right of the center line.

column2: 15. This road sign means:
column4: You are approaching a T-intersection
column6: Designates an overpass above a divided highway
column8: The road you are on intersects with a divided highway
column10: You must turn left or right

column2: 16. When driving behind a motorcycle, drivers must:
column4: pass the motorcycle in the same lane.
column6: remembers that motorcyclists have the right to use a complete traffic lane.
column8: share the lane with the motorcycle.
column10: drive on the shoulder beside the motorcycle.

column2: 17. When driving in fog, drivers should use:
column4: high beam headlights.
column6: low beam headlights.

column2: 18. If you need to stop when other drivers may not expect it:
column4: look over your shoulder for traffic in your blind spot.
column6: quickly tap your brake pedal a few times.
column8: sound your horn to alert other drivers.
